description: Holds attributes of an ANS image component. In the Arc ecosystem, these are stored in Anglerfish.
title: An image.

$eref.description: The primary language of the content. The value should follow IETF BCP47. (e.g. 'en', 'es-419', etc.)
$eref.title: Describes language for an element

$eref.description: A grab-bag object for non-validatable data.
$eref.title: Has additional properties

$eref.description: Optional field to story story workflow related status (e.g. published/embargoed/etc)
$eref.title: Status

$eref.description: Trait that applies contains the content restrictions of an ANS object.
$eref.title: Content Restrictions

___content_code.description: The content restriction code/level/flag associated with the ANS object

$eref.description: Tracking information, probably implementation-dependent
$eref.title: Tracking

$eref.description: Additional information to be displayed near the content from the editor.
$eref.title: Editor_Note

$eref.description: When the content was last updated (RFC3339-formatted).
$eref.title: Last Updated Date

$eref.description: Holds the collection of tags, categories, keywords, etc that describe content.
$eref.title: Taxonomy

___associated_tasks.description: A list of WebSked task IDs that this content was created or curated to satisfy.

___topics.description: A list of topics. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

___seo_keywords.description: A list of user-editable manually entered keywords for search purposes. In the Arc ecosystem, these can be generated and saved in source CMS systems, editors, etc.

___sections.description: A list of site objects or references to them. In the Arc ecosystem, references in this list are denormalized into sites from the arc-site-service.  In a multi-site context, sites will be denormalized against an organization's default website only.

___primary_site.description: Deprecated in 0.7.1. (See `primary_section` instead.) A primary site object or reference to one. In the Arc ecosystem, a reference here is denormalized into a site from the arc-site-service.

___primary_section.description: A primary section object or reference to one. In the Arc ecosystem, a reference here is denormalized into a site from the arc-site-service.

___sites.description: Deprecated in 0.7.1. (See `sections` instead.) A list of site objects or references to them. In the Arc ecosystem, references in this list are denormalized into sites from the arc-site-service.  In a multi-site context, sites will be denormalized against an organization's default website only.

___stock_symbols.description: A list of stock symbols of companies related to this content. In the Arc ecosystem, these can be generated and saved in source CMS systems, editors, etc.

___named_entities.description: A list of named entities. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

___keywords.description: A list of keywords. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

___auxiliaries.description: A list of auxiliaries. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

$eref.description: The descriptions, or blurbs, for the content.
$eref.title: Description

$eref.description: When the content was originally created (RFC3339-formatted). In the Arc ecosystem, this will be automatically generated for stories in the Story API.
$eref.title: Created Date

$eref.description: The RFC3339-formatted dated time of the most recent date the story was (re)displayed on a public site.
$eref.title: Display_Date

$eref.description: The version of ANS that this object was serialized as, in major.minor.patch format.  For top-level content objects, this is a required trait.
$eref.title: Describes the ANS version of this object

$eref.description: A short reference name for internal editorial use
$eref.title: Slug

$eref.description: A globally unique identifier of the content in the ANS repository.
$eref.title: Globally Unique ID trait

$eref.description: An Address following the convention of http://microformats.org/wiki/hcard
$eref.title: Address

$eref.description: Trait that applies workflow information to a document or resource. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.
$eref.title: Workflow information

___status_code.description: Code indicating the story's current workflow status. This number should match the values configured in WebSked.

___note.description: This note will be used for any task automatically generated via WebSked task triggers.

$eref.description: A description of the location, useful if a full address or lat/long specification is overkill.
$eref.title: Location related trait

$eref.description: When the story was published.
$eref.title: Publish_Date

$eref.description: The relative URL to this document on the website specified by the `canonical_website` field. In the Arc ecosystem, this will be populated by the content api from the arc-canonical-url service if present based on the canonical_website. In conjunction with canonical_website, it can be used to determine the SEO canonical url or open graph url. In a multi-site context, this field may be different from the website_url field.
$eref.title: Canonical URL

$eref.description: A url-shortened version of the canonical url.
$eref.title: Short_Url

$eref.description: Trait that represents a story's pitches. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.
$eref.title: Pitches

___platform.description: A list of the story's pitches to a platform.

___publication.description: A list of the story's pitches to a publication.

$eref.description: Trait that applies revision information to a document. In the Arc ecosystem, many of these fields are populated in stories by the Story API.
$eref.title: Revision

___user_id.description: The unique user id of the person who created this revision.

___branch.description: The name of the branch this revision was created on.

___parent_id.description: The unique id of the revision that this revisions was branched from, or preceded it on the current branch.

___revision_id.description: The unique id of this revision.

___published.description: Whether or not this revision's parent story is published, in any form or place

___editions.description: A list of identifiers of editions that point to this revision.

___licensable.description: True if the image can legally be licensed to others.

$eref.description: An optional list of output types for which this element should be visible
$eref.title: Channel trait

$eref.description: Lists of promotional content to use when highlighting the story. In the Arc ecosystem, references in these lists will be denormalized.
$eref.title: Promo Items

$eref.description: The sub-headline(s) for the content.
$eref.title: Sub-Headlines

$eref.description: Information about a third party that provided this content from outside this document's hosted organization.
$eref.title: Distributor

___name.description: The human-readable name of the distributor of this content. E.g., Reuters.

___subcategory.description: The machine-readable subcategory of how this content was produced. E.g., 'freelance - signed'. May vary between organizations.

___category.description: The machine-readable category of how this content was produced. Use 'staff' if this content was produced by an employee of the organization who owns this document repository. (Multisite note: content produced within a single *organization*, but shared across multiple *websites* should still be considered 'staff.') Use ‘wires’ if this content was produced for another organization and shared with the one who owns this document repository. Use 'freelance' if this content was produced by an individual on behalf of the organization who owns this document repository. Use 'stock' if this content is stock media distributed directly from a stock media provider. Use 'handout' if this is content provided from a source for an article (usually promotional media distributed directly from a company). Use 'other' for all other cases.

$eref.description: When the story was first published.
$eref.title: First Publish Date

$eref.description: Trait that applies planning information to a document or resource. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked. Newsroom use only. All these fields should be available and editable in WebSked.
$eref.title: Scheduling information

___deadline_miss.description: The delta between the story's planned publish date and actual first publish time, in minutes.

___scheduled_publish_date.description: When the content was first published.

___planned_publish_date.description: When the content is planned to be published.

___inch_count_actual.description: The current length of the story in inches.

___line_count_actual.description: The current length of the story in lines.

___word_count_planned.description: The anticipated number of words in the story.

___line_count_planned.description: The anticipated length of the story in lines.

___inch_count_planned.description: The anticipated length of the story in inches.

___internal_note.description: This note is used for shared communication inside the newsroom.
___internal_note.title: Internal Note

___websked_sort_date.description: Date to be used for chronological sorting in WebSked.

___budget_line.description: Used for the newsroom to identify what the story is about, especially if a user is unfamiliar with the slug of a story and the headline or they do not yet exist. Newsroom use only.
___budget_line.title: Budget Line

___url.description: An optional destination url of this label.

___display.description: If false, this label should be hidden.

$eref.description: What the Washington Post calls a Kicker
$eref.title: Label

___basic.description: The default label object for this piece of content.

___url.description: An optional destination url of this label.

___display.description: If false, this label should be hidden.

$eref.description: Information about the original source and/or owner of this content
$eref.title: Source

___name.description: Deprecated in  0.7.1. See `distributor.name`. (Formerly: The human-readable name of the organization who first produced this content. E.g., 'Reuters'.)

___source_type.description: Deprecated in 0.7.1. See `distributor.category` and `distributor.subcategory`. (Formerly: The method used to enter this content. E.g. 'staff', 'wires'.)

___edit_url.description: A link to edit this content in its source CMS.

___source_id.description: The id of this content in a foreign CMS.

___system.description: The software (CMS or editor) that was used to enter this content. E.g., 'wordpress', 'ellipsis'.

$eref.description: Comment configuration data
$eref.title: Comments

___display_comments.description: If false, do not render comments on this content.

___moderation_required.description: If true, comments must be moderator-approved before being displayed.

___comments_period.description: How long (in days) after publish date until comments are closed.

___allow_comments.description: If false, commenting is disabled on this content.

$eref.description: A property used to determine horizontal positioning of a content element relative to the elements that immediately follow it in the element sequence.
$eref.title: Alignment

$eref.description: Lists of content items or references this story is related to, arbitrarily keyed. In the Arc ecosystem, references in this object will be denormalized into the fully-inflated content objects they represent.
$eref.title: Related_Content

___redirect.description: An attached redirect. In Arc, when this content item is fetched by url, content api will instead return this redirect object with appropriate headers.  In all other cases, this content should be treated normally.

$eref.description: Latitidue and Longitude of the content
$eref.title: Geo

$eref.description: The headline(s) or title for this content.  The 'basic' key is required.
$eref.title: Headlines

$eref.description: Key-boolean pair of syndication services where this article may go
$eref.title: Syndication

___search.description: Necessary so that we can filter out all articles that editorial has deemed should not be discoverable via search

___external_distribution.description: Necessary for fulfilling contractual agreements with third party Globe and Mail clients

$eref.description: A copyright notice for the legal owner of this content. E.g., 'Â© 1996-2018 The Washington Post.' Format may vary between organizations.
$eref.title: Copyright information

$eref.description: Various unrelated fields that should be preserved for backwards-compatibility reasons. See also trait_source.
$eref.title: Owner information

___name.description: Deprecated in 0.7.1. See `distributor.name`. (Formerly: The human-readable name of original producer of content. Distinguishes between Wires, Staff and other sources.)

___sponsored.description: True if this content is advertorial or native advertising.

___id.description: The machine-readable unique identifier of the organization whose database this content is stored in. In Arc, this is equivalent to ARC_ORG_NAME.

$eref.description: A list of people and groups attributed to this content, keyed by type of contribution. In the Arc ecosystem, references in this list will be denormalized into author objects from the arc-author-service.
$eref.title: Credit trait

___by.description: The primary author(s) of this document. For a story, is is the writer or reporter. For an image, it is the photographer.
___by.title: By

___photos_by.description: The photographer(s) of supplementary images included in this document, if it is a story. Note that if this document is an image, the photographer(s) should appear in the 'by' slot.
___photos_by.title: Photos by

$eref.description: A more granular type than story, gallery, etc. (E.g., column, blog_post)
$eref.title: Subtype trait
